column4: Hi, I am having trouble with an ubuntu system.  It has been compromised and every evening it floods my network.  I have tracked it down (ps -aux | grep perl) give the following
remove that x file
I would blow away your apache folder and try again, but if you want to track it down you probably can if you read that x script
at the very least start by removing execute perms
I'd like to see the script if you can post it somewhere
absolutely not
haha ok, yeah, your system's probably hosed if it's messing with /proc
yeah that sounds more than a naive attempt, just format and reinstall, sorry
the only backing up you should be doing is with a pen and paper
clean the machine completely

if you want to take the recordings somewhere isolated and put them back on the machine after a reinstall to see if they're corrupted, go for it, but you might need to reinstall a second time if your machine gets compromised again
you could give it a shot, but I would expect a windows virus scanner to miss linux viruses almost certainly
wait, is everything in /proc owned by www-data, or just that one process folder?
oh that's normal
yeah I'd like to see that folder, can you upload it somewhere?
preferably somewhere it'll last for a couple days, I have to make sure my secure install is up to date before I unpack it there
yeah ok, can you do a find / -user www-data as root?
it looks like you didn't get everything, but maybe you did
oh ok, guess some things are just empty
alright well thanks, I'll take a look at this this weekend hopefully
see my pm
